pullRequest.body: This is a backport of changes made by @Ruben-VandeVelde. These attributes had no effect, and will become illegal on v4.9.0.

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8981977897/job/24668599606)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8981977897/job/24668598657)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8981977897/job/24668598956)
This was adding the reducible attribute a second time, which will become illegal in v4.9.0 (as a sanity check).

I don't think either the old or the new spelling works correctly:
```lean
import Mathlib

@[to_additive (attr := reducible)]
def one := 1

example : one = 1 := by with_reducible rfl
example : zero = 0 := by with_reducible rfl -- fails


@[reducible, to_additive]
def one' := 1

example : one' = 1 := by with_reducible rfl
example : zero' = 0 := by with_reducible rfl -- fails
```
I think the correct fix is `attribute [reducible] Equiv.smul` on the line below, maybe with a TODO about `to_additive`.
Note that `smul` is already defined several lines above, and has `reducible` there already.
I suspect this one is still needed, considering https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/12691/files#r1590771359
Okay, I agree this one needs to be changed.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: remove pointless @[reducible] attributes
